qas.question: In what neighboring countries are passenger elevators required to adhere to Standard A17.1?

answers.text: Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators

qas.question: What is the equivilent to the US Standard A17.1 called in Canada?
What are passenger elevators tested with?

context: In <a0_0>most US and Canadian jurisdictions<a0_0/>, passenger elevators are required to conform to the American Society of Mechanical Engineers' Standard A17.1, <a1_0>Safety Code for Elevators and Escalators<a1_0/>. As of 2006, all states except Kansas, Mississippi, North Dakota, and South Dakota have adopted some version of ASME codes, though not necessarily the most recent. In Canada the document is the <a2_0>CAN/CSA B44 Safety Standard<a2_0/>, which was harmonized with the US version in the 2000 edition.[citation needed] In addition, passenger elevators may be required to conform to the requirements of A17.3 for existing elevators where referenced by the local jurisdiction. Passenger elevators are tested using the <a3_0>ASME A17.2 Standard<a3_0/>. The frequency of these tests is mandated by the local jurisdiction, which may be a town, city, state or provincial standard.
